BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: JOHN JAY COLLEGE OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE AUXILIARY SERVICES, SUCH AS FOOD AND BOOKSTORE SERVICES, FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE CAMPUS COMMUNITY OF THE JOHN JAY COLLEGE OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO PROVIDE AUXILIARY SERVICES, SUCH AS FOOD AND BOOKSTORE SERVICES, FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE CAMPUS COMMUNITY OF THE JOHN JAY COLLEGE OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE. THE JOHN JAY COLLEGE OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE AUXILIARY SERVICES CORPORATION, INC. WAS CREATED FOR THE PURPOSE OF SUPPORTING, DEVELOPING, AND CULTIVATING EDUCATIONAL, SOCIAL, CULTURAL, AND RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES AMONG STUDENTS, FACULTY, AND STAFF.
IRS990.Desc: ENGAGE IN ACTIVITIES AND EVENTS TO PROMOTE THE COLLEGE WITHIN THE COMMUNITY, NATIONALLY, AND INTERNATIONALLY.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: MANAGEMENT AND USE OF COLLEGE FACILITIES, INCLUDING THE THEATER.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: SUPPORT THE STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS AND PROGRAMS.

BooksInCareOfDetail.PersonNm: HELEN CEDENO CO DEPT OF FINANCE

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE AUXILIARY IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE (THE CODE); THEREFORE, NO PROVISION FOR INCOME TAXES IS REFLECTED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE AUXILIARY HAS BEEN CLASSIFIED AS A PUBLICLY SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION THAT IS NOT A PRIVATE FOUNDATION UNDER SECTION 509(A) OF THE CODE. THE AUXILIARY PRESENTLY DISCLOSES OR RECOGNIZES INCOME TAX POSITIONS BASED ON MANAGEMENT'S ESTIMATE OF WHETHER IT IS REASONABLY POSSIBLE OR PROBABLE THAT A LIABILITY HAS BEEN INCURRED FOR UNRECOGNIZED INCOME TAXES. MANAGEMENT HAS CONCLUDED THAT THE AUXILIARY HAS TAKEN NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT REQUIRE ADJUSTMENT IN ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. U.S. FORMS 990 FILED BY THE AUXILIARY ARE SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: SUPPORT FOR SCHOLARSHIPS AND ACTIVITIES OF JOHN JAY COLLEGE

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CORPORATION AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS WHO FULFILL CERTAIN CRITERIA DEVELOPED BY JOHN JAY COLLEGE OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: REVIEW OF THE ORGANIZATION'S FORM 990 IS COORDINATED WITH THE JOHN JAY COLLEGE OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE'S ACCOUNTING OFFICE AND THE ORGANIZATION'S INDEPENDENT AUDIT FIRM. WHEN THE REVIEW IS COMPLETED, THE FORM 990 IS DISTRIBUTED ELECTRONICALLY TO ALL OF THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD MEMBERS BEFORE IT IS SIGNED AND/OR E-FILED WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY STATEMENT IS DISTRIBUTED (OR EMAILED) TO THE BOARD MEMBERS AT THE FIRST BOARD MEETING (OR SOON THEREAFTER) OF THE FISCAL YEAR. IF THERE IS A TRANSACTION THAT INDIRECTLY OR DIRECTLY DERIVES A POTENTIAL CONFLICT TO A PARTICULAR BOARD MEMBER, THEN HE OR SHE REMOVES HIM/HERSELF FROM THE BOARD'S ASSESSMENT OF THAT PARTICULAR TRANSACTION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE AUXILIARY DOES NOT COMPENSATE ANY OF THE INDIVIDUALS REPORTED IN PART VII OF THE FORM 990 OR PART IX LINE 7; ALL COMPENSATION IS PAID BY A RELATED ORGANIZATION, JOHN JAY COLLEGE OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE. JOHN JAY COLLEGE OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE IS ONE OF THE COLLEGES OF THE CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK. THE PROCESS BY WHICH COMPENSATION IS DETERMINED IS GOVERNED BY AUSPICES OF THE UNIVERSITY'S PERSONNEL OFFICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NO CHANGES HAVE TAKEN PLACE DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2023.
